docs.lead_paragraph: THE SICKNESS ON BOARD THE ILLINOIS.--There is, apparently, great cruelty and injustice see in the Health Officer at Quarantine, in compelling the passengers by the Illinois to remain on board that vessel, but, we think that the public will approve the caution of the Health Officer in guarding against every possible danger at this season of the year. There have several eases of fever out on board the Illinois and two have proved fatal.

headline.main: OEMOCRATIC. POLITICS.; interview with Mayor Wood's Private Secretary. SOME HINS TO JAMES R. WHITING. Presidential Candidates for 1360. Another Warble from Beind the Scenes,

docs.lead_paragraph: Your Bird since its last chant has verity be-. come a bird of flight-though it would doubtless flutter with intensest indignation should it be deemed a flighty bird when thus soreding its pinions before your admiring readers.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail Steamship Idinois, C. S. BOGGS, U. S. N., Commander, arrived at his port early yesterday morning. She left Aspinwall a: 9.30.P. M. on the 19th of August. On the night of the 23d, ran ashore on Colorado Reef, near Avenas Cay, where she remained till the night of the 26th; arrived at Havana on the afternoon of the 27th, and left at 1 P. M. on the 29th.

headline.main: Troubles of the Opera Singers--Their Salaries and Profits.; SUPREME COURT--SPECIAL TERM

docs.lead_paragraph: Before Hon. Justice Peabody. Joseph Fells VS. Felicita Vestvali and Henry Vestvali--The plaintiff was employed by the defendants as operatic agents in August, 1853, to employ for them singers for the Vestvali Opera Company, and for the transaction of other business. Henry Vestvali being the manager of the troupe and Felicita the prima donna.

docs.lead_paragraph: BROOKLYN BOARD OF EDUCATION.--This Board met at 5 o'clock P. M. on Tuesday, President SMITH in the Chair. The minutes were read and approved. The evening g School Committee were authorized to open the evening schools at such time as they may deem expedient, and make all other necessary arranger ments to carry the intentions into effect.

headline.main: CITY GOVERNMENT.; How paris is Governed--How the Streets are Kopt Clean, and How the Cab Says vice is Managed.

docs.lead_paragraph: Perhaps you will think it is not my business at this distance, to talk of the dirty streets, and the mal-administration of the City of New-York, so I will hasten to tell you why I attack this subject. A New-Yorker asked me the other day if I thought of coming homesoon?

headline.main: EMANCIPATION CONVENTION.; Origin of the Movement--Elihu Barritt--Let turn Received in Indorsement of the Project.

docs.lead_paragraph: The first Convention veer assembled on this continent for the purpose of devising measures for the compensated emacipation of the Southern Slaves, concluded its session yesterday in this city. It is propert - state that this gathering was brought about by the instrumentality of men of all parties and sections, who are possessed of sage experience.

headline.main: MRS. CUNNINGHAM.; Mrs. C. Deeply Affected--Her Return to the Tombs. The Habeas Corpus Argued Before Judge Peabody. DECISION RESERVED.

docs.lead_paragraph: At 121/2 o'clock on Tuesday, Judge PEABODY, having disposed of the cases before him, took his seat upon the BEach in the Circuit Court room to hear the argument on the Cunninguam habcas curpus. District Attorney Hall stated that he had been notified in behalf of the people to attend upon a writ of habeas corpus, predicated upon a criminal complaint which was now pending in the Court of General Sessions of the Peace.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Money panic, which was last week kept within the precincts of Wall-street, yesterday assumed the more threatening phase of a Bank excitement. The Bank of the Mechanies'Association closed its doors at an early hour, or rather shut up the inside shop, while the door on Wall. street was the scene of a large gathering of dealers, bill-holders and news-mongers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Commodore STEPHEN CASSIN died at his residence in Georgetown, D.C., on Saturday, in the 76th year of his age. He entered the navy fifty ? years ago, when a boy, and served under PSHEY? at the naval battle on Lake Erie, where he distinguished himself, and was promoted.
